item.title: Inter Milan could bring Romelu Lukaku back
item.description:
According to reports, Romelu Lukaku, the struggling Chelsea forward, has renewed Inter Milan’s interest in bringing him back to Italy this summer. According to multiple sources, Inter Milan CEO Giuseppe Marotta is excited to see the top-belgian striker don the club’s jersey once more.

Fabrizio Romano, a well-known sports journalist, confirmed the story on his social media account:

In the next hours, the Inter board will meet with Romelu Lukaku’s counsel. The Belgian striker wishes to return to Inter, but Chelsea has yet to discuss the formula, salary, and other details. Chelsea paid 115 million euros for Lukaku a year ago, so it’s a convoluted arrangement.

Despite finishing the season as the club’s leading scorer with 15 goals in all competitions, the Belgian forward has been widely criticized for failing to justify his purchase price.

The speculation of a probable return to Inter is not new. His controversial Sky Sports interview, in which he revealed his discontent with Chelsea’s current system of play and expressed his desire to return to Inter Milan, was chaotic and drew significant condemnation.

Inter Milan will find it tough to get a good deal out of Lukaku’s new Chelsea contract. Regardless, we’ll keep you updated on the situation.
